key_facts: Most of the world’s population is exposed to polluted air.
Only seven countries met WHO air quality standards in 2022.
Chad, Bangladesh, Pakistan, India, and the DRC are the most polluted countries.
Australia and Estonia met WHO air quality guidelines.
Africa lacks sufficient air quality monitoring infrastructure.
Lack of monitoring hampers accurate air pollution reporting.
The U.S. is ending its global air quality monitoring program.
Over 30 countries relied on the U.S. monitoring program.
Climate change is worsening air quality by increasing wildfires.
Wildfires are becoming longer and more intense.
The report calls for more comprehensive air quality monitoring.
The report urges global action to combat air pollution.
